page.title: 01SPENNITHORNE & HARMBY GEN.
page.content: SPENNITHORNE AND HARMBY ARE SITUATED IN LOWER WENSLEYDALE.HARMBY IS SET ABOVE THE RIVER URE.FROM HARMBY BANK ONE LOOKS WEST ACROSS THE RIVER TO THE TOWN OF MIDDLEHAM BEYOND.THE ROAD DOWN FROM HARMBY VEERS SHARPLY TO THE S.E. AS IT NEARS SPENNITHORNE.POST WAR YEARS HAVE SEEN THE VILLAGES CHANGE FROM SMALL HAMLETS A MILE APART TO MUCH LARGER VILLAGES SEPARATED BY ONLY A FIELD.PRIVATE AND COUNCIL HOUSES HAVE BEEN BUILT.HARMBY IS A SPRAWLING VILLAGE WITH A LARGE ESTATE OF MODERN BUNGALOWS.THE REST OF THE AREA IS FARMLAND WITH SMALL AREAS OF WOODLAND. THE SOIL IS NOT FIRST-CLASS BUT A WIDE VARIETY OF CROPS IS GROWN AND THERE IS EXCELLENT PASTURE FOR THE SHEEP AND CATTLE THAT ABOUND.THE SCENIC BEAUTY ATTRACTS TOURISTS FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD. TOTAL POPULATION APPROX.550.
